value.title: Document your Power BI Desktop models with DAX Studio!
value.excerpt: Extract a list of measures, tables, etc, from your Power BI model with DAX Studio.  Download the PPUtility add-in here: http://www.sqlbi.com/tools/power-pivot-utilities  Link to DAX STUDIO: https://daxstudio.codeplex.com/  Our Playlists: - - Join our DAX Fridays! value.title: Download/ Export Power Query data to csv, excel or txt - Power BI Tips & Tricks #25
value.excerpt: Do you want to export your power query data? In this video I show you how to do it :)  How to install R: https://goo.gl/g4wbEm BI accountant blog: https://goo.gl/lnjjxM Link to Power BI file: https://gofile.me/2kEOD/YPnFQZQ4c  R script: require(gdata) write.table(trim(dataset), file=”C:/writeyourfilepathhere/filename.txt”,

value.title: Export Power Query data into SQL and do incremental refresh - Power BI Tips & Tricks #49
value.excerpt: In today’s video I will show you how to export data from power query or power bi into SQL. Really useful for example if you want to come around the limitiation of the lack of increment loads functionality in Power BI.  Some important links: BIInsight blog: http://biinsight.com/exporting-power-bi-data-to-sql-server/

value.title: Extract in Power Query (LEN, LEFT, RIGHT in excel) - #6 (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the equivalents of LEN, LEFT; RIGHT in Power Query. You can create very complex transformations using the interface in Power Query.  Keynotes: 02:46 -Text Before delimiter 03:37 - Count lenth of text 04:03 - Extract First character 04:11 - Extract Last Character 04:16

value.title: How to create functions in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to create a custom function in Power Query.  Custom functions are re-usable pieces of code. So, as a rule, if you write the same code more than three times, you should do a function.  In this video I go through, step by step, how to create a function to import excel

value.title: Import your excel model into Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you spent hours creating an excel model with Power Query and PowerPivot and you or your company has now decided to move to Power BI?  Well, don't worry, you can import your excel models in Power BI and most of it will be imported, included the visuals if you created them using Power View, Yey!

value.title: Insert text anywhere in a cell without adding a new column using the Power Query User Interface.

value.title: Power BI Tips & Tricks #07: Change multiple hardcoded path sources at once in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you have opened a power bi file on a different computer that has excel, csv, txt as source files, you probably have seen the error message telling you that Power bI could not find a part of the path.  I am going to show you an easy way to solve this.  Here you can download the pbix file: http://trantor.synology.me:5000/fbsharing/nc9kfXTw

value.title: Power BI vs Excel: When you should use each tool
value.excerpt: Which tool is best? Power BI or Excel?  Well, it depends on what you are trying to do. Both tools have unique strengths and limitations and in this video I will try to show both.  Hopefully after watching this video, you will have a better understanding of both tools and will know when to use which depending
